description:
## Theory
The last type of allowed logical sources that this tutorial will cover are xml files. In this case, the mapping must specify that the dataType is ***ql:XPath***. In order to use a xml file as logical source, we must provide an iterator that references an element. 

    <#TriplesMap> rml:logicalSource [ 
		    rml:source "Vehicles.xml" ; 
		    rml:referenceFormulation ql:XPath; 
		    rml:iterator "/vehicle/bike"; 
		].

See more about XPath [here](https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-10/).

## Hands-on
### Task
Complete the mapping below specifying that the format of the file is a xml by using ***ql:XPath*** and specify that the subjects are ***sch:Place***.
### XML file content

    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"  ?>
    <locations>
	    <place>
		    <name>Oneonta</name>
		    <surface>90.16</surface>
		    <population>1812</population>
		    <latitude>44.9625428</latitude>
		    <longitude>-74.4168577</longitude>
		</place>
		<place>
			<name>Iowa</name>
			<surface>167.2</surface>
			<population>133611</population>
			<latitude>29.6862705</latitude>
			<longitude>-82.319746</longitude>
		</place>
		...
	</locations>
